definitions: a flat, thin, typically ornamental tablet or plate of metal, porcelain, or wood, that is fixed to a wall or other surface, often as a memorial
a harmful deposit of fatty material or other substances on the inner lining of an arterial wall
a film of mucus and bacteria on a tooth surface
examples: The commemorative plaques lined the corridor.
Dentists often advise regular removal of plaque.
Arterial plaques can lead to heart disease.
